result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Paul Reinhart

records.addlTxt:
1:59 PM Defendant Joshua Paul Reinhart appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gail Ann Prost appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Public defender needs more time to appoint counsel.  Defendant will file court appointed paperwork.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Court tolls time limits.
Prelim reset:
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.

2:15 pm - Defendant Joshua Paul Reinhart appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.
Preliminary hearing on October 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Joshua Paul Reinhart appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Heather M Faeh in court for Joshua Paul Reinhart.  Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
IA moved up from 10-10-22 to 10-03-22 to ride along with another new charge defendant has set for 10-03-22.
RE:  Felony bail jumping as repeater, on 09-17-22.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of  4 counts felony bail jumping, misdemeanor bail jumping, possess drug paraphernalia and disorderly conduct.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 10-10-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 1.  Bail is set at $3,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he have no contact with C.M.P., DOB: 08-01-1971 and S.L.P., DOB: 10-30-1970 with exception of incidental contact.    Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
